item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Update 1.03 Out Now Ahead of The Forsaken Hollows DLC
item.description:
From Software has just released the highly anticipated update 1.03 for Elden Ring, preparing the grounds for the upcoming Forsaken Hollows DLC. This update brings significant balance changes, performance improvements, and a few surprises for tarnished warriors.

Patch Notes Highlights

  • Weapon Balancing: Rivers of Blood has seen a slight adjustment (again), making it more viable in PvE but less oppressive in PvP.
  • Performance: Fixed stuttering issues in the Lake of Rot area on PC.
  • New Quest Steps: Added new dialogue lines for NPC Jar Bairn.

The community is already digging into the files to see if there are any hidden secrets leading into the Forsaken Hollows. Stay tuned for our full breakdown of the DLC when it launches next week.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Gameplay Snippet Shows Fresh Area That Sure Looks a Lot Like Resident Evil 1
item.description:
Capcom has dropped a new teaser for Resident Evil Requiem, and fans of the original game are going to be very happy. The brief 30-second clip showcases a mansion hallway that bears a striking resemblance to the Spencer Mansion from the 1996 classic.

A Return to Survival Horror?

The developers have promised a return to the slower, more methodical pacing of the early titles. “We want players to feel the tension of opening every door,” said the lead director.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Is the Biggest New Third-Party Game Launch on Xbox Game Pass of 2025
item.description:
The turn-based RPG Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has taken the gaming world by storm, shattering records for day-one Game Pass launches in 2025. Developed by a small indie team, the game features stunning visuals and a unique “reactive turn-based” combat system.

Why It’s A Hit

  1. Visual Style: Using Unreal Engine 5 to its fullest.
  2. Story: A deep, emotional narrative about a cursed expedition.
  3. Music: Orchestral score that rivals Triple-A productions.

“We never expected this level of reception,” said the studio head. “It’s a dream come true.”

item.title: Apple designates popular iPhone model obsolete, leaving furious users without support
item.description:
In a move that has sparked outrage on social media, Apple has officially designated the iPhone 12 Pro as “obsolete.” This means the device will no longer be eligible for hardware service at Apple Stores or Authorized Service Providers.

Users are complaining that the device is still perfectly capable. “It’s barely 5 years old!” tweeted one user.

This move follows Apple’s standard protocol, but many feel the timeline is shrinking.
